title: So is Yasuo in need of a nerf now?
body: I've seen too many yasuo's pop off ridiculously hard with a Frozen Mallet, PD, and full tank... Is Yasuo in need of a nerf or frozen mallet in need of one?

It's specifically because Yasuo is about the only user of Mallet and only real melee user of PD.  They are essential items to his build.  Yasuo's ability to get on to carries while being fairly tanky is what makes PD so strong on him specifically, and mallet combined with his dash makes it impossible for even the most slippery ADC to get away from him.

Other common PD users, vayne, trist, even graves, can't really jump straight to the backline without risking getting blown up trying to get there.  If the PD passive was, say, a mini-malz passive, or a stronger but more situational 50% dr when cc'ed, it actually helps squishier builds who can be locked up and eliminated in a single cc, but a guy who has a longer time to kill gets less out of it because he spends a lower percentage of the fight cc'ed or initiating and has a higher uptime of just soaking damage.

It's also harder for Annie to farm if she's holding onto a stun, since she doesn't have the greatest AD and won't be getting any items or runes to help it.
Annie doesn't need the farm, though. If Annie is autoing, but the enemy can't even do that, guess who wins in farm.

Y'know, I've always been aware of the fear of Annie's stun, but I don't think I've ever seen someone just go ahead and passively zone themselves just because she has it, which the Boards seems to imply is the case. Most mid laners seem to be able to farm well enough at a good range that I can't see how an Annie would be able to zone them from properly CS'ing unless she puts herself in the precarious position of being between you and the creeps which is a bit more dangerous than is necessary for her in most cases due to the possibility of jungler interference.

Most mages can actually outrange Annie with skillshots or the like, so if she meanders forwards holding onto a stun she can be punished for it due to her shorter range.   She's best when she can bring up a stun and then immediately trade with an opponent who's trying to CS, rather than trying to zone with it.  (The people Annie can actually zone with a stun like that tend to be assassins, and yeah, Annie does well against them; actual mages can usually deal with her better.)

Jungle ganks are a thing too, as you've said.  The best way to punish someone who can trade well and is very aggressive is to gank them; it's the main reason you never see toplane Mordekaiser all that much (even back before his rework, he was super strong in short range 1v1 lanes but very vulnerable to ganks).

First, Yasuo double dips on fervor with his auto-attacks and his q's, secondly, fervor is non-scaling, so a yasuo who barely has an ad items gets as much added raw damage as the adc does, but therein lies the problem.  Percentage-wise fervor is vastly different for the two.  

For example, a full build ashe would typically have almost 360 total ad, factor in 70% crit and an ie and that ashe is doing about 775 damage a hit.  While using flurry boosts it to almost 1050 damage a hit.  Fervor is on hit so doesn't crit, and adds 112 damage.  Right under 10% increase in damage.

Now, full build bruiser Yas has 175 total AD.  With PD he's at 30% crit, so roughly 220 damage on hit average factoring his passive.  He attacks at least 1.7 times a second and q's every 1.3 seconds with the TF proc every 1.5 seconds, assuming everything is 100% optimal in a 15 second fight he gets 25 auto attacks, 11 q's, and 10 TF procs.  That's 4000 damage added from fervor and 2200 damage added from spellblade with the breakdown even further of 7900 from total AD, and 1100 from q's bonus damage.  So add it all up and you have a little over 26% of his total damage coming from fervor and a little under 15% from spellblade.

TL;DR, Ashe gets about 10% of her damage from fervor.  For bruiser yas it's over 25% of his damage.  That is what makes it so broken on him compared to ADC's.
But why nerf fervor for other things because Yas abuses it? With fervor being needed, you have 2 situational keystones with Warlord's and Deathfire.  It would nerf Rene for example.
